article.headline: California 51, Cal Poly-SLO 41
article.story: BERKELEY, Calif. -- Jorge Gutierrez overcame a terrible shooting night to make a key 3-pointer with 1:09 left to play as California held on to beat Cal Poly 51-41 on Saturday. Markhuri Sanders-Frison had 15 points and 10 rebounds for his second career double-double while Gutierrez finished with 10 points on 4 of 14 shooting to help the Golden Bears snap a two-game losing streak at home. The win was also the 599th of coach Mike Montgomery's career, sixth most among active Division I coaches. California (6-4) shot just 38.6 percent from the field as a team but outscored Cal Poly 12-2 over the final 3 minutes. Shawn Lewis scored 16 points for Cal Poly (3-7) and moved within 36 of becoming the 15th player in Mustangs history to reach 1,000 for his career. The loss was the fourth in a row for Cal Poly.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
